ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Recite: And your Lord is the Most Generous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Read, for your Lord is most beneficent,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Recite: and your Lord is Most Generous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Recite! Your Lord is the most Honorable One,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Read, and your Lord only is the Most Beneficent,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Read! And your Lord is the Most Generous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Read and your Lord is Most Honorable,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Recite: And thy Lord is the Most Generous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Read: And thy Lord is the Most Bounteous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Read! Your Lord is the Most Bountiful One
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Recite thou: And thy Lord is the Most Bounteous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Read, and your Lord is the most generous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Proclaim! And thy Lord is Most Bountiful,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Read! And your Lord is the Most Generous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Read! Your Lord is the Most Generous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Read: And your Lord is the Most Generous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [96:3] Recite: (reiterating the first one) and your Lord is the Most Generous, having no counterpart in terms of His generosity (wa-rabbuka’l-akram is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the subject [of the verb] iqra’, ‘recite’),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: He said to him: (Read) the Qur'an, Muhammad: (And thy Lord is the Most Bounteous) and your Lord is Clement and forgives the ignorance of the servants,
